mil6.2.1:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil6.2.1:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
mil6.2.1:1.2_0: ‘From where does those who enjoy non-proliferation’?”
mil6.2.1:1.3_0: “Great king, the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection.”
mil6.2.1:2.1_0: “Sir, those who speak of stream-entry, once-returning, non-returning, and reaching the fruit of once-returning; and they questioned past these monks; and they examined their meaning; and they remembered an exposition of the teaching on the verses spoken by the Realized One?”
mil6.2.1:3.1_0: “Great king, those mendicants who recited this verse was recited, questioning, obsess, stories, amazing accounting, and analyses; in progress, exposive expositions, and classifications are the fifth.
mil6.2.1:3.2_0: But that, great king, because of past deeds, for one, and for the sake of impurity of mind, ripening in the forest.
mil6.2.1:3.3_0: Those mendicants who are envied by these.
mil6.2.1:4.1_0: Suppose a person was to draw a field sown in its own field, so that a person would pull out of the mud, then chop off his crops. Then they’d pull out of sand, spit it out by the thicket, and put it aside.
mil6.2.1:4.2_0: The crops of them all that had been prepared for that day.
mil6.2.1:4.3_0: In the same way, there are those who previously developed and cultivated plants and seeds that were impure, bright, or clever, and able to beat them up.
mil6.2.1:4.4_0: But the monks who started to look for the arrows of these. They also look down on them, thinking,
mil6.2.1:5.1_0: Or suppose a person were to carry a large tree trunk, the reed-pleather had some fruit, or the fruit, and all the fruits of that tree. Then they’d carry off that fruit, put away the wood, and chop off his tree.
mil6.2.1:5.2_0: The quenchment, the fruit of that,
mil6.2.1:5.3_0: In the same way, there are those who previously developed and cultivated plants and seeds for one part of the trees with psychic power ...
mil6.2.1:5.4_0: But the mendicants who brought the mattresses of the stuffed with truths that they carry off such as the fruit, the tree, or the fruit of that tree.
mil6.2.1:6.1_0: But suppose a person was to carry around the meaning of the ear-pleather and the owners.
mil6.2.1:6.2_0: One gathering is debates, and devoted to the assembly.
mil6.2.1:6.3_0: The search for the meaning of that, for the purpose of searching.
mil6.2.1:6.4_0: In the same way, there are those who previously developed and cultivated the six direct knowledges, expressing their minds, and immerse themselves in samādhi.
mil6.2.1:6.5_0: But the mendicants who seek the Great Ascetic for those who work in this way, make them easy to admonish, having, gathered and deliberately seated in the assembly.
mil6.2.1:7.1_0: Here are very helpful, since you, great kings, and many duties of gifts and much to give gifts.
mil6.2.1:7.2_0: Your Majesty, just as they had been told, and the kings of mountains with defeats and bushed.
mil6.2.1:7.3_0: In the same way, great king, for questioning, there are lots of property and assets, and even a bushing.
mil6.2.1:7.4_0: if all of them were to advise and instruct you, then you wouldn’t be done.
mil6.2.1:7.5_0: But because you’ve heard the elder and senior, the senior monks should branch out his arms; that’s why you acted like this, for your learning. And that’s why you haven’t become a lot of leftover.”
mil6.2.1:7.6_0: “I have given it up, sir; that’s how you answer.
